title: Healthy Chole (Chickpea Curry)
description: A popular and flavorful North Indian chickpea curry, packed with protein and fiber.

ingredients.name: chickpeas
ingredients.preparation: dried, soaked overnight, or 2 cans (15 oz each), drained and rinsed

instructions.description: If using dried chickpeas, pressure cook soaked chickpeas with salt and enough water until tender (about 15-20 mins after first whistle). Retain the cooking water. If using canned, rinse well.
Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili. Sauté for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates from the masala.
Add chole masala and mix well. Cook for another minute.
Add the cooked chickpeas along with some of their cooking water (or add fresh water if using canned). Aim for a thick gravy consistency.
Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low heat for 10-15 minutes, allowing flavors to meld. Mash some chickpeas against the side of the pot to thicken the gravy if desired.
Check salt and adjust consistency with more water if needed.
Serve hot with bhature, roti, naan, or rice.
